description: The CMake targets file specifies build targets, their configuration, and dependencies used by the project. All properties are required by default, unless explicitly marked as optional under certain conditions.

$schema.description: The schema against which to verify this document

$id.description: A unique identifier for the schema resource

externalDeps.description: The list of third party dependencies usable by the project's targets, whether resolved from outside the project directories or vendored within it

remotes.description: Third party dependencies whose sources or binaries are not stored in the project directories and must be located or fetched by the build system

^[^\\s]+$.description: The name of the dependency (also called 'PackageName' in CMake) used to find the file 'Find<PackageName>.cmake' with find_package(). It must be compatible with CMake's PackageName requirements.

rulesFile.description: The CMake file that defines how to integrate the dependency into the build system. Must be either 'generic', to use a predefined rules file, or a relative path to a file ending with '.cmake'

optional.description: Indicates whether the dependency is optional (true) or required (false) (only required if rulesFile is 'generic')

minVersion.description: The minimum acceptable version of the dependency (only required if rulesFile is 'generic'). Can be empty to indicate no minimum version.

integrationMethod.description: The method used to find the dependency between 'FIND_PACKAGE', 'FETCH_CONTENT', 'FIND_THEN_FETCH' and 'EXTERNAL_PROJECT' (only required if rulesFile is 'generic')

packageLocation.description: Additional location to search for the dependency package (only required if rulesFile is 'generic' and integrationMethod is 'FIND_PACKAGE' or 'FIND_THEN_FETCH')

windows.description: Additional search path to the directory containing the package for Windows (never required). Must be absolute.

unix.description: Additional search path to the directory containing the package for Unix (never required). Must be absolute, with no whitespace.

macos.description: Additional search path to the directory containing the package for MacOS (never required). Must be absolute, with no whitespace.

downloadInfo.description: The information required to download the dependency package (only required if rulesFile is 'generic' and integrationMethod is 'FETCH_CONTENT', 'FIND_THEN_FETCH' or 'EXTERNAL_PROJECT')

kind.description: The download method to use (only required if rulesFile is 'generic')

repository.description: URL of the repository (only required if rulesFile is 'generic')

tag.description: Branch name, tag, commit hash or id (only required if rulesFile is 'generic' and kind is 'git' or 'mercurial'). Can be empty to indicate no tag.

hash.description: Hash of the file to be downloaded (only required if rulesFile is 'generic' and kind is 'url'). Can be empty to indicate no hash.

revision.description: Revision to checkout from the repository (only required if rulesFile is 'generic' and kind is 'svn'). Can be empty to indicate no revision.

build.description: Additional dependency settings for building (only required if rulesFile is 'generic')

compileFeatures.description: List of optional compile features that must be enabled or disabled when compiling code that consumes the dependency (e.g. ["cxx_std_20", "cxx_thread_local", "cxx_trailing_return_types"]) (only required if rulesFile is 'generic')

compileDefinitions.description: List of optional compile definitions that must be defined when compiling code that consumes the dependency (e.g. ["DEFINE_ONE=1", "DEFINE_TWO=2", "OPTION_1"]) (only required if rulesFile is 'generic')

compileOptions.description: List of optional compiler options that must be supplied to the compiler when compiling code that consumes the dependency (e.g. ["-Wall", "-Wextra", "/W4"]) (only required if rulesFile is 'generic')

linkOptions.description: List of optional linker options that must be enabled or disabled when linking code that consumes the dependency (e.g. ["-s", "-z", "/INCREMENTAL:NO"]) (only required if rulesFile is 'generic')

vendoredBinaries.description: Third party dependencies whose precompiled binaries are stored within the project directories and integrated into the project as imported targets

vendoredSources.description: Third party dependencies whose source files are stored within the project directories and must be built as part of the project

targets.description: The list of binary targets for the project that will need to be built

^\\w+(/.+)?$.description: The path to the directory where the target is defined. It must be unique and there cannot be more than one target per directory.

name.description: A unique name for the target

type.description: The type of binary to generate for this target: static library ('staticLib'), shared library ('sharedLib'), header-only ('interfaceLib'), or executable ('executable')

build.description: Settings used to configure compilation and linking

compileFeatures.description: List of optional CMake compile features required by the target (e.g. ["cxx_std_20", "cxx_thread_local", "cxx_trailing_return_types"])

compileDefinitions.description: List of optional preprocessor definitions applied when compiling this target (e.g. ["DEFINE_ONE=1", "DEFINE_TWO=2", "OPTION_1"])

compileOptions.description: List of optional compiler options passed to this target (e.g. ["-Wall", "-Wextra", "/W4"])

linkOptions.description: List of optional linker options passed to this target (e.g. ["-s", "-z", "/INCREMENTAL:NO"])

mainFile.description: The main source file (.cpp) that serves as the entry point or primary compilation unit for this target. Must be a path to a file ending with .cpp, .cc, or .cxx.

pchFile.description: The header file used as precompiled header (PCH) for this target (optional). Must be a path to a file ending with .h, .hpp, .hxx, .inl or .tpp.

headerPolicy.description: Defines the policy applied to the header files

mode.description: Defines whether public headers are split ('split') or merged ('merged') with private headers

includeDir.description: The relative path to the directory in 'include/' from which public headers are collected (only required if mode is 'split')

dependencies.description: List of internal and external dependency names this target depends on
